details.description: Charity tax exemptions and reliefs, apply for charitable status, reclaim tax on Gift Aid, tax-efficient giving, profits and expenditure
details.body:
Find tax guidance for charities on the HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) website.

Charities may qualify for a range of tax reliefs and exemptions, but they do have to pay tax on some income.

See the HMRC website for guidance on:

  • getting recognised as a charity for tax purposes
  • exemptions, reliefs and what you need to pay
  • charities and VAT
  • claiming back tax on Gift Aid donations
  • tax relief on land, buildings and shares
  • accepting donations from the Payroll Giving scheme
  • tax on money your charity spends
  • dealing with profits

Community amateur sports clubs aren’t counted as charities, but they do get certain exemptions and benefits.
